CatDescriptText: Mr. Frank Mitchell, 925 Adelaide Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 1, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that 18-year-olds should be given the privilege of voting?" answer reads: "Yes. I would say that nowadays, kids of 18 years of age are more qualified to vote than those of a similar age 10 or 15 years ago.  At 18 years of age, an average youth, today, has the I.Q. that one of 21 had about 10 or 15 years ago."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Frank Mitchell wearing Peoples Cab cap standing on Liberty Avenue across from Jenkins Arcade, Downtown
